title: National Foster Care Month, 2025
summary:
The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump, declaring May 2025 as National Foster Care Month. It emphasizes the crucial role of families in raising children and the significant contributions of foster parents who provide care and support to children in need. The proclamation highlights that over 360,000 children and youth annually require the stability of foster care, and acknowledges the collaborative efforts of various professionals in improving the lives of these young individuals.

The document also mentions the Family First Prevention Services Act, which aims to keep families intact through evidence-based interventions, addressing root causes of family conflicts. The First Lady's BE BEST initiative is noted for its focus on supporting youth, particularly those who have experienced foster care, to help them achieve their potential.

The proclamation calls upon all Americans to support children in foster care and recognize the vital contributions of foster families and caregivers, reinforcing the nation's commitment to ensuring every child has the opportunity for a safe and nurturing environment.
